text:
Hello Everyone, i have a question related to VS code Prettier formating and the {{ }} of HubSpot. So i have this piece of code
```{{ standard_header_includes|replace('<script src="/hs/hsstatic/jquery-libs/static-1.1/jquery/jquery-1.7.1.js"></script>','<script src="<https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.6.0.min.js>"></script>') }}```
Which replaces the jquery version.

So when i save the document in VS code it formats it like that:
```{{ standard_header_includes|replace('
        <script src="/hs/hsstatic/jquery-libs/static-1.1/jquery/jquery-1.7.1.js"></script>
        ','
        <script src="<https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.6.0.min.js>"></script>
        ') }}```
Which breaks the function or the use once it is uploaded in HubSpot.

I am trying this :
```<!-- prettier-ignore -->
        {{ standard_header_includes|replace('<script src="/hs/hsstatic/jquery-libs/static-1.1/jquery/jquery-1.7.1.js"></script>','<script src="<https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.6.0.min.js>"></script>') }}```
But Prettier keeps formating it.

Do you know any solution?
Thank you very much

Reminder: Don’t forget to keep your HubSpot CLI up to date to ensure you have the latest CLI features, bug/usability fixes and performance improvements.
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#upgrade|How to upgrade your CLI to the latest version>.
